item.title: Senate GOP bill spares nuclear and geothermal energy while hammering wind and solar
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The Senate Finance Committee’s language would take a sledgehammer to some parts of the renewable-friendly Inflation Reduction Act while sparing others.

item.title: Mastodon updates its terms to prohibit AI model training
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Social networks are bolstering their terms of service against scrapers and bots that crawl the website to train AI models. Days after Elon Musk-owned X updated its terms to explicitly prohibit AI model training, decentralized social network Mastodon today updated its own rules to bar any kind of model training, as well. “We explicitly prohibit […]

item.title: Sword Health nabs $40M at $4B valuation, pushes IPO plans to at least 2028
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The digital health startup says it secured the fresh capital to update its valuation and finance acquisitions.

item.title: As grocery shortages persist, UNFI says it’s recovering from cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The ongoing outage is preventing the company from fulfilling and distributing customer orders at scale.

item.title: UK watchdog fines 23andMe over 2023 data breach
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The ICO said over 150,000 U.K. residents had data stolen in the breach.

item.title: Amazon is holding Prime Day 2025 on July 8-11
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Amazon has revealed that Prime Day 2025 will take place on July 8-11, extending the annual sale event to four days this year. Amazon notes that consumers will be able to shop for “pantry staples and snacks for summer gatherings to home-improvement must-haves, back-to-school supplies, health and personal care finds, family-favorite toys, best-selling books, pet […]

item.title: Two-year-old defense tech Mach Industries confirms $100M raise led by Khosla, Bedrock
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Rising-star defense tech Mach Industries has announced a new $100 million round from Khosla, Bedrock and Sequoia.

item.title: Adobe’s Firefly comes to iOS and Android
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Adobe is launching its Firefly mobile app on iOS and Android for consumers to create AI-powered media

item.title: Honda dips its toes in cargo delivery micromobility
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Honda will supply last-mile delivery companies with the Fastport eQuad.

item.title: US court denies Apple’s request to dismiss antitrust case concerning iCloud
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: The lawsuit alleges Apple violates competition laws by forcing users of its devices to back up critical files and device settings on iCloud.

item.title: Sequoia-backed Crosby launches a new kind of AI-powered law firm
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: The tech industry talks a lot about how AI is going to transform work. Legal startup Crosby, which just came out of stealth, is an extreme example.

item.title: Observability startup Coralogix becomes a unicorn, eyes India expansion
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Coralogix, an Israeli startup offering a full-stack observability and security platform, has raised $115 million at a pre-money valuation of over $1 billion, almost doubling in three years from its last round in 2022. With the influx of cash, the startup is looking to expand its engineering base in India and develop its AI agent. […]

item.title: Prominent global VC Endeavor Catalyst is raising $300M, sources say
item.dc:creator: Tage Kene-Okafor
item.description: Endeavor Catalyst, the co-investment fund affiliated with global entrepreneurial network Endeavor Global, is raising a new $300 million fund, its fifth and largest fund yet, as it looks to deepen its bet on high-growth startups across Africa, Latin America, the Middle East, and Southeast Asia, TechCrunch has learned. The new fund, according to sources, is […]

item.title: Google to scale up AI-powered fraud detection and security operations in India
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Google has unveiled its Safety Charter in India, which will expand its AI-led developments for fraud detection and combating scams across the country, the company’s largest market outside the United States. Digital fraud in India is rising. Fraud related to the Indian government’s instant payment system UPI grew 85% year-over-year to nearly 11 billion Indian […]

item.title: Spotify’s Daniel Ek just bet bigger on Helsing, Europe’s defense tech darling
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Spotify's Daniel Ek just led a €600 million investment in Helsing, a four-year-old, Munich-based defense tech company that is now valued at €12 billion, according to the Financial Times. The deal makes it one of Europe's most valuable privately held companies; it also highlights Europe's scramble to build its own military muscle as the world grows messier and the U.S. turns inward.

item.title: You can now set up double dates with friends on Tinder
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Tinder launched a new Double Date feature, which allows users to team up with friends and chat with potential matches together.

item.title: The cracks in the OpenAI-Microsoft relationship are reportedly widening
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: OpenAI and Microsoft have an increasingly strained relationship, according to a recent WSJ report.

item.title: Finland warms up the world’s largest sand battery, and the economics look appealing
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Pornainen recently turned on a 100 MWh thermal battery filled with ground up soapstone.

item.title: Instagram tests a reposts feature
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Instagram is testing the ability for users to repost posts, the company confirmed to TechCrunch on Monday.

item.title: Instagram users complain of mass bans, pointing finger at AI
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Instagram users report that their accounts were banned even though they had not violated the company's terms of service or other policies.
